 void addServer(WebSocketServer aServer)

Constructor Detail

BaseEngine

public BaseEngine()
Method Detail

startEngine

public void startEngine()
                 throws WebSocketException
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Starts the engine. Usually an engine is implemented as a thread which waits for new clients to be connected via a WebSocketConnector. So here usually the listener threads for incoming connections are instantiated.

Specified by:
startEngine in interface WebSocketEngine
Throws:
WebSocketException

stopEngine

public void stopEngine()
                throws WebSocketException
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Stops the engine. Here usually first all connected clients are stopped and afterwards the listener threads for incoming new clients is stopped as well.

Specified by:
stopEngine in interface WebSocketEngine
Throws:
WebSocketException

engineStarted

public void engineStarted()
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Is called after the web socket engine has been started sucessfully. Here usually the engine notifies the server(s) above that the engine is started.

Specified by:
engineStarted in interface WebSocketEngine

engineStopped

public void engineStopped()
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Is called after the web socket engine has (been) stopped sucessfully. Here usually the engine notifies the server(s) above that the engine has stopped.

Specified by:
engineStopped in interface WebSocketEngine

connectorStarted

public void connectorStarted(WebSocketConnector aConnector)
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Is called after a new client has connected. Here usually the engine notifies the server(s) above that a new connection has been established.

Specified by:
connectorStarted in interface WebSocketEngine

connectorStopped

public void connectorStopped(WebSocketConnector aConnector)
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Is called after a new client has disconnected. Here usually the engine notifies the server(s) above that a connection has been closed.

Specified by:
connectorStopped in interface WebSocketEngine

isAlive

public boolean isAlive()
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Returns true if the engine is running or false otherwise. The alive status usually represents the state of the main engine listener thread.

Specified by:
isAlive in interface WebSocketEngine
Returns:
true or false based on the server status

processPacket

public void processPacket(WebSocketConnector aConnector,
                          WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Processes an incoming data packet from a certain connector. The implementation of the engine usually simply passes the packets to the server(s) of the overlying communication tier.

Specified by:
processPacket in interface WebSocketEngine

sendPacket

public void sendPacket(WebSocketConnector aConnector,
                       WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Sends a data packet to a certain connector.

Specified by:
sendPacket in interface WebSocketEngine

broadcastPacket

public void broadcastPacket(WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Broadcasts a data packet to all connectors. Usually the implementation simply iterates through the list of connectors and calls their sendPacket method.

Specified by:
broadcastPacket in interface WebSocketEngine

removeConnector

public void removeConnector(WebSocketConnector aConnector)
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Removes a certain connector from the engine. This usually has not to be done by the application but by the engine implementations only.

Specified by:
removeConnector in interface WebSocketEngine

public int getSessionTimeout()
Returns:
the sessionTimeout

setSessionTimeout

public void setSessionTimeout(int aSessionTimeout)
Parameters:
aSessionTimeout -

getConnectors

public java.util.List<WebSocketConnector> getConnectors()
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Returns the list of clients connected to this engine. Please consider that a server can support multiple engines. This method only returns the clients of this engine.

Specified by:
getConnectors in interface WebSocketEngine
Returns:
the connectors

getServers

public java.util.List<WebSocketServer> getServers()
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Returns a list of all servers that are currenly bound to this engine. This list of servers is maintained by the engine and should not be manipulated by the application.

Specified by:
getServers in interface WebSocketEngine
Returns:
the server

addServer

public void addServer(WebSocketServer aServer)
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Registers a server at the engine so that the engine is able to notify the server in case of new connections and incoming data packets from a connector. This method is not supposed to be called directly from the application.

Specified by:
addServer in interface WebSocketEngine

removeServer

public void removeServer(WebSocketServer aServer)
Description copied from interface: WebSocketEngine
Unregisters a server from the engine so that the engine won't notify the server in case of new connections or incoming data packets from a connector. This method is not supposed to be called directly from the application.

Specified by:
removeServer in interface WebSocketEngine
